hero.title: Hello, I'm Muhammed Furkan
hero.text: I am a computer engineer who is constantly striving to improve myself in the software and web world.

about.title: About Me
about.text:
Hello! I'm Muhammed Furkan, a software developer. I took my first steps into the world of software development in 2021, and since then, I have been continuously striving to improve myself.

My hunger for learning drives me to explore new technologies and stay updated with the latest trends. I embrace an agile and flexible approach to keep up with the ever-evolving software systems.

I focus on full-stack web projects and have nearly 2 years of experience in backend development using powerful frameworks like Laravel. Additionally, I'm learning and using modern technologies like Vue and Nuxt to make my applications more impressive. I also utilize various tools to enhance my skills in the DevOps field.

goal.title: My Goals
goal.summary: You can explore my experiences and goals.

items.title: Algorithmic Mastery
content: I believe that understanding algorithms goes beyond just knowing their syntax.
As a result, I continuously strive to improve my algorithmic problem-solving skills.
In this direction, I consistently work to enhance the quality of my code and make it compliant with SOLID principles.
My goal is to write code in alignment with design patterns.

items.title: Compatibility and Work Discipline
content: In the software world, I think it's essential to realize that software development is not limited to coding and algorithm development.
I aim to collaborate harmoniously with colleagues and prioritize knowledge sharing.
Especially, I enjoy asking questions about topics or structures that I believe can help me improve.

items.title: Best Practices
content: After learning a new language or framework and working on small projects with it, I focus on structuring my work according to best practices to avoid issues during updates or additions, especially when targeting user-facing or production projects.
In this context, I aim to separate my backend and frontend projects, adopting a microservices architecture, and I work to enhance the professionalism of my projects.

items.title: DevOps and Server Realm
content: I'm working on managing my own servers using services like AWS and Digital Ocean. I'm improving my skills in Linux server management, including technologies like Nginx, Redis, and reverse proxy.
For backend tasks, I utilize these Linux servers while using deployment tools like Vercel and Netlify for my frontend projects. I'm planning to completely separate frontend and backend projects.
In the future, I plan to learn technologies like Docker to achieve platform independence.

items.title: Packaging and Open Source Software
content: I intend to package frequently used code snippets into packages and distribute them using package managers like Node.js and Composer.
This approach aims to expedite project development and enable bulk updates independently of individual projects.
Furthermore, I aspire to release automation and web projects on GitHub that can be beneficial to the open-source community.

items.title: Data Optimization
content: I consider database design as a pivotal stage in backend development. Therefore, I emphasize database design and data relationships when planning a project.
In the future, I plan to merge projects with Artificial Intelligence and data mining, focusing on data optimization and data accuracy.
In this endeavor, my university project involving data classification, coupled with my experience in areas like Full Text Search and Elastic Search, provides a solid foundation.
